title: Your Cash Helps Pay for Those Free Stock Trades
text:
Investors at some of the country’s biggest brokerages won’t have to pay commissions on stock trades any longer, but they’ll be paying in another—less obvious, critics say—way: paltry returns on cash.

One of the biggest and fastest-growing sources of revenue for brokerages is the net interest income derived their customers’ clearing accounts, where they pay customers low interest rates for holding their money and lend it to others at higher rates. The revenue derived from these so-called sweep accounts, which are used to hold...
description: Investors at some of the country’s biggest brokerages won’t have to pay commissions on stock trades any longer, but they’ll be paying in another—less obvious, critics say—way: paltry returns on cash.
